divs: sighting detailson or about 20 october 1996, 0230 hrs. clear night, unknown temp, but crispy cold. humidity unk, however conditions existed where you could see your breather vapor when breathing. i was an a1c, on duty air force security police airman as a passenger in my flight chiefs vehicle. patrol car was facing west. i was talking to my flight chief looking out his driver���s door window. movement at the top edge of the window frame caught my attention; i noticed a brilliant white\off white light move at the top edge center of the window straight down. the luminosity of the light was bright enough to compare with venus, however, the size of the light was about the size of a bb or one of the round metal ball links on a pull chain for a light closet or ceiling fan. the light, (#1), continued straight down from the upper edge of the window frame. as it reached a quarter way down the space of the window, a second light, (#2), (same size and color intensity) appeared slightly to the left of #1 and began to trail #1 starting from the top of the frame straight toward the horizon. both lights appeared to be traveling the same rate; #2 light did not over take #1 light and, #1 did not pull away from #2, keeping equal distance from each other. as #1 light now reached the middle of the window, it immediately took a 90dg left turn (right as you looked at it) the was no arch to this turn it was previously travelling in a straight downward direction then an immediate 90dg turn and headed west until it disappeared from sight. the #2 light continued in a straight downward direction until it disappear at the horizon. both lights did not have any flaring, pulsating, or oscillation of lights. it was a solid color white or off white color. no twinkling of different colors. the lights did not have a tail trail like you would see a meteor reentry. sightings of both these objects lasted approximately 4 seconds. long enough for me to yell to my flight sergeant, "holy cow! do you see that!" as he turned the objects had disappeared, and us being air force police, he was looking for something in his immediate surroundings. as i was stammered that he did not see anything and i was highly amped up with what i saw, he continued to press me for info. i told him, he sat back in his seat, looked at me and asked if i needed to be taken for a psych eval. i told him, as i continue to tell people to this day of that event; you can take me to whoever you want! i saw what i saw, and you will never get me to change my mind on what i just observed. i just feel lucky that i am one of the few to have experienced the possibility of witnessing a true unidentified flying object. not just one but two on my sighting. sighting of both these objects lasted approximately 4 seconds. long enough for me to yell to my flight sergeant, "holy cow!
